trans-unit.source: Base designer class for extending the design mode behavior of, and providing a root-level design mode view for, a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that supports nested controls and should receive scroll messages.
This designer is a root designer, meaning that it provides the root-level design mode view for the associated document when it is viewed in design mode.
You can associate a designer with a type using a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute>.
For an overview of customizing design time behavior, see [Extending Design-Time Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d6ac8a6a-42fd-4bc8-bf33-b212811297e2).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner"></xref> class.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Checks for the existence of a menu editor service and creates one if one does not already exist.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to ensure has a context menu service.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.GlyphCollection"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph"></xref> objects.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.GlyphSelectionType"></xref> value that specifies the selection state.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph"></xref> objects.
Indicates whether the specified tool is supported by the designer.
If a tool is supported, it will be enabled in the toolbox when the designer receives focus.
Otherwise, it will be disabled.
Once a tool is marked as enabled or disabled it can not be queried again.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to test for toolbox support.
`true` if the tool should be enabled on the toolbox; `false` if the document designer doesn't know how to use the tool.
Initializes the designer with the specified component.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to associate with the designer.
Initializes the menuEditorService variable to `null`.
Called when the context menu should be displayed.
This method displays the context menu of the document designer.
The horizontal screen coordinate to display the context menu at.
The vertical screen coordinate to display the context menu at.
Called immediately after the handle for the designer has been created.
Adjusts the set of properties the component exposes through a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref>.
This <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerFilter> interface method override adds a set of properties to this designer's component at design time.
This method adds the following browsable properties: "Location", and "BackColor".
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the properties for the class of the component.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules"></xref> for the designer.
This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules> that prevents the document from being resized.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules"></xref> values.
Selects the specified tool.
<xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.ToolPicked%2A> is called when the user double-clicks on a toolbox item.
The document designer should create a component for the specified tool.
Only tools that are enabled in the toolbox will be passed to this method.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to create a component for.
Processes Windows messages.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology"></xref> that indicates a particular view technology.
An object that represents the view for this designer.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner.SupportedTechnologies"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> interface.
An array of supported <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology"></xref> values.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.GetToolSupported(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> interface.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to be tested for toolbox support.
`true` if the tool is supported by the toolbox and can be enabled; `false` if the document designer does not know how to use the tool.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.ToolPicked(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> interface.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to select.
